data.title: Hogyan tehetem a YouTube Vancedet alap√©rtelmezett alkalmaz√°ss√°?
data.description:
Ahogy a c√≠mben is van, rengeteg felhaszn√°l√≥ k√©rdezte m√°r, hogy hogyan tudj√°k a YouTube Vancedet alap√©rtelmezett√© be√°ll√≠tani a YouTube linkek megnyit√°s√°ra m√°s alkalmaz√°sokb√≥l (mint a b√∂ng√©sz≈ëk, √ºzenetk√ºld≈ë alkalmaz√°sok √©s b√°rmilyen m√°s alkalmaz√°s).

Nem root verzi√≥t haszn√°l√≥k r√©sz√©re a megold√°sok fel lettek osztva, mint OneUI, MIUI √©s a t√∂bbi. Jelenleg nem tudunk megold√°st biztos√≠tani minden OS-re, √©s lehet mag√°nak kell r√°keressen a Google-n.

fields.title: OneUI felhaszn√°l√≥k:
fields.content:
1. Tap and hold down on YouTube or YouTube Vanced app icon from your app drawer.
2. Tap **App info**.
3. Find "**Set as default**" and tap it
4. Tap "**Open supported links**" and choose "**Open in this app**"

In older versions of OneUI, the name of the options in the 4th step might be slightly different. You may need to tap "**Go to supported URLs**" and choose "**In this app**" option.
In the very older version of OneUI üí©, you may need to go to **Settings** > **Apps** > *[tap three dots at the right corner]* > **Default apps** > **Set as default**. After apps loaded Find YouTube Vanced or YouTube and follow the 4th step...

fields.title: MIUI felhaszn√°l√≥k:
fields.content:
1. Open Settings
2. Go to **Apps**,
3. **Manage apps**,
4. Then, tap the three dots at the right corner,
5. **Default apps**,
6. **Opening links**.
7. Wait until all your apps gets listed‚Ä¶
8. Find YouTube or YouTube Vanced and tap it.
9. Tap "**Open supported links**" and choose "**Open**"

fields.title: AOSP & egy√©b egy√©ni UI-k (OOS, ColorOS, EMUI, stb.):
fields.content:
1. Open **Settings**
2. Go to **Apps**
3. Tap **Default apps**
4. Find **YouTube** or **YouTube Vanced**
5. Tap "**Go to Supported URLs**" and choose "**Open in this app**" option

If you're still troubling with this, you may need to search some "how to" articles/videos on [Google](https://www.google.com/search?q=%22android%22+how+to+open+youtube+links+with+youtube) or you can install a 3rd party app from [Play Store](https://play.google.com/store/search?q=open%20with) to save you from this hassle‚Ä¶

data.title: A root v√°ltozat mi√©rt nem a microG core-al m≈±k√∂dik?
data.description:
1. You need to have at least the [pico](https://github.com/opengapps/opengapps/wiki/Pico-Package) variant of GApps to run Vanced.

2. You can‚Äôt run Vanced with microG Core without Google Play Services Framework which is available in all GApps packages and it's a required library.

3. If you are worried about your privacy & don‚Äôt want to use GApps but still want to use watch YouTube without ads, then the [web version](https://youtube.com) is always available.

data.title: Mi√©rt nem m≈±k√∂dik a t√ºkr√∂z√©s?
data.description: For users with v16.16.38 and all above non-root variants and root variants who are using microG based ROMs, there's a bug in upstream microG. Until that resolves, please wait for updates or roll back to v15 versions. If you use Google Play Services with root variants, you won't have any problems with casting.

data.title: Mi az APK Al√°√≠r√°s?
data.description:
You are reading this because you are not using Vanced Manager or you may have installed Vanced from an unofficial source.

data.title: YouTube Vanced a Play √Åruh√°zban?
data.description:
NO!
Again, DO NOT install or even try to search for any fake apps named "YouTube Vanced" or similar on the Play Store or any app stores to install Vanced.

We only have [Vanced Guide](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.vanced.faq), and it's the only official app published on Play Store.

If you find any other app with our icon and name, report it as impersonation and give it a bad review.

Our apps can only be found at [official site](https://vancedapp.com).

data.title: Mi√©rt nem j√°tsz√≥dnak le a vide√≥k?
data.description: Try restarting the app. It might also because of your internet connection or your device.

data.title: Mi√©rt van 480p limit?
data.description: Due to the COVID-19, Google is restricting data usage of several countries. This happens on the server and affects both Vanced and stock YouTube users.

fields.title: Megold√°sok:
fields.content:
1. Connect to a VPN of a different region.
2. Use the [web version](https://youtube.com)
3. Since the 480p restriction is only for phones and not tablets, you can change the device model in YouTube Vanced to overcome the restriction.

#### How to change the device model?
1. Open YouTube Vanced.
2. Go to Settings
3. Tap the `Vanced Settings`
4. Enable hidden settings:
  - Scroll down and tap on the `About` section till you get a message saying `Hidden settings enabled`.
5. Go to `Codec override`
6. Set manufacturer to `Samsung` and model to `SM-T865`.
7. Restart the app.

After restarting, the 480p limit should be gone.

data.title: Hogyan rejthet≈ë el a microG √©rtes√≠t√©s?
data.description:
To hide microG the notification,

1. You can disable battery optimization for Vanced microG and reboot your device.

2. If the above method doesn't work, disable microG notifications by holding on to the notification, toggle it off and tap Save.

> Disabling app notifications can be done in different ways depending on the Android user interface. If you don't know how to disable it, try using Google for learning how to disable it.

data.title: Az 1440p jobban n√©z ki az 1080p-s kijelz≈ën?
data.description:
Yes, but only if the video ratio is something like 18:9, 21:9, ... You can enable `Stats for nerds` in Settings > General to confirm it.

To enable higher resolutions, go to Vanced settings > Video settings and turn on `Max resolution` then restart the app.
